descript.abstract: NPL site POLYGON locations for the US EPA Region 9. NPL (National Priorities List) sites are hazardous waste sites that are eligible for extensive long-term cleanup under the Superfund program. Eligibility is determined by a scoring method called Hazard Ranking System. Sites with high scores are listed on the NPL. Area covered by this data set include Arizona, California, Nevada, Hawaii, Guam, American Samoa, Northern Marianas and Trust Territories. Attributes include NPL status codes, NPL industry type codes and environmental indicators. Related table, NPL_Contaminants contains information about contaminated media types and chemicals. This is a one-to-many relate and can be related to the feature class using the attribute CERCLIS_ID. Generally, each NPL polygon has a separate source. Information about sources for each polygon can be found in the related table, NPL_POLY_METADATA. This table contains a record for each site that has information about the source. Polygons for non-Federal Facility sites were updated in January, 2007 for the Superfund Work Load Models project. Each polygon was approved by the site RPM. Where available, the majority of these polygons represent the surface expression of the extent of the contamination. All Federal Facilities are represented by the facility boundary. The following sites currently have no polygon data available at this time: Alameda Naval Air Station, Jet Propulsion Lab (NASA), Lab for Energy-Related Health Research / Old Campus, Lawrence Livermore National Lab (Site 300)(USDOE), and Stoker. 4 polygons represent combined NPL sites that have merged plume boundaries.
descript.purpose: This data is specifically designed for use with ArcGIS and related extensions. This data is useful for detailed, large scale maps and web mapping applications.

idinfo.useconst: The NPL polygon data is suitable for large scale mapping.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.1850

dataqual.logic: Polygons were compared to other boundary information. All non-Federal Facility polygons were verified by the Superfund RPM.

horizpa.horizpar: Positional accuracy varies for each polygon. Most polygon boundaries represent the extent of contamination. All Federal Facilities are represented by facility boundaries.

procstep.procdesc: Used the EME to move metadata into SDE.
Added polygon for BF Goodrich site.
Updated attribute information. NPL Status, Human Exposure Status, Construction Status
Update attribute information. NPL Status, Human Exposure Status, Construction Status and online plume boundary map links

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Name of NPL site - primary site name
Name of second site when polygons overlap.
Name of third site when polygons overlap.
Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

overview.eaover:
CERCLIS_1 - EPA CERCLIS ID number. Unique ID for each facility. NPL_NAME_1 - Name of site SUBAREA_NAME_1 - Subarea name where site has more than one OU. CERCLIS_2 - EPA CERCLIS ID number. Unique ID for each facility. Used when polygon is a combination of multiple NPL sites. NPL_NAME_2 - Name of site. Used when polygon is a combination of multiple NPL sites. CERCLIS_3 - EPA CERCLIS ID number. Unique ID for each facility. Used when polygon is a combination of multiple NPL sites. NPL_NAME_3 - Name of site. Used when polygon is a combination of multiple NPL sites. BOUNDARY_TYPE - Boundary type can be the extent of the contaminated plume(s), facility boundary or a combination of each.
SITE_STATUS -This is the status of a site in relation to the National Priorities List. The following are descriptions of status codes: F - Currently on the Final NPL P - Proposed for the NPL R - Removed from the Proposed NPL S - Pre-proposal site A - Site is part of an NPL site D - Deleted from the Final NPL C - Final NPL, Construction completed W - Withdrawn from NPL list
FF_STATUS - Federal Facility status. Each site is either a Federal Facility or a private site. COMMENTS - Comments STREET - Street location CITY - City location COUNTY - County location STATE - State location ZIPCODE - Zipcode SOURCE - Source of site polygon. All private sites were acquired from the Superfund RPM. All Federal Facilities were acquired from OERR-EMSL-EPIC group.
NPL_STATUS - Final, Deleted, or Proposed.
RESC_CAT_CODE & DESCRIPTION - Codes and descriptions for the primary type of facility and/or contamination OT - Other MP - Manufacturing/Processing/Maintenance MI - Mining MT - Multiple RE - Recycling WM - waste Management
RSSC_SUB_CAT_CODE & DESCRIPTION - Codes and descriptions for the sub-category type of facility and/or contamination. AG - Agriculture BS - Batteries/Scrap CA - Chemicals CL - Co-disposal/landfills DT - Drums/Tanks EE - Electrical Equipment GP - Groundwater Plume IF - Industrial Waste MD - Mine Tailings ME - Metals MO - Military/Ordnance MT - Multiple NM - Non-metals OP - Ordnance Production OR - Oil/Gas Production OT - Other PR - Plastics/Rubber PS - Production Storage RD - Research/Development TP - Transportation TS - Trucks/Ships/Airplanes WO - Waste/Used Oil WP - Lumber/Wood Products
SITE_STATUS(Construction) - NPL production category. Investigation/Design Early Action Construction Underway Construction Completed Deleted
HUMAN_HEALTH This is for the environmental indicators. Under current conditions at this site, potential or actual human exposures are under control. YES = Under Control NO = Not Under Control Insufficient Data = Not enough information to conclude human safety
RELATED TABLE NPL_CONTAMINANTS - Related by EPA_ID To the CERLICS_ID in the feature class. This is a one-to-many relate. Contamination can occur in more than one media type and include more than one chemical. The source for this data is the CERCLIS database. EPA_ID = CERCLIS_ID - unique identifier for each site. SITE_NAME = Name of NPL site CAS_NO = Unique identifier for each chemical CHEM_NAME = Name of chemical
CONTAM_MEDIA = Media type that contamination occurs in. Air Buildings/Structures Debris Groundwater Leachate Liquid Waste Other Sediment Soil Solid Waste Surface Water
CONTAM_GROUP = Groups for chemical types Base Neutral Acids Dioxins/dibenzofurans Inorganics Metals Nitroaromatics Not Provided Oil & Grease Organics PAH (Polycyclic Aromatic Hydrocarbons) PCBs Pesticides Petroleum Hydrocarbon Radioactive VOC (Volatile Organics)
Related Table R9_NPL_Polys_Metadata - related by CERCLIS_ID. A one-to-one relationship. CERCLIS_ID = Unique identifier from the CERCLIS database SITE_NAME = Name of NPL site CONTRACTOR_COMPANY = Contracting company responsible for GIS work for individual site. CONTRACTOR_INFO = Contractor contact information RPM_01_15_07 = Superfund RPM assigned to individual NPL sites as of Jan. 15, 2007 PHONE = Phone number for RPM ORIGINAL_DATA_TYPE = Original media type of data furnished by the contractor SOURCE_DATE = Date of last update SOURCE_SCALE = Map scale of source SOURCE_PROJECTION = Original data projection. SOURCE_OF_DATA = Source of original data type. ORIGINAL_DATA_FILE = Name of original data file DATA_GEN_METHOD = DATA_NAME = Name of GIS data after conversion from original media FINAL_DATA_NAME = Final GIS data name in coverage format COMMENTS = Comments that may be useful.

distinfo.distliab: Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the Environmental Protection Agency, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the accuracy or utility of the data on any other system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. It is strongly recommended that careful attention be paid to the contents of the metadata file associated with these data to evaluate data set limitations, restrictions or intended use. The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
